relevant_findings.soft_abdomen: Soft and diffusely tender, particularly on the right side.
relevant_findings.pelvic_examination: Cervix was dilated 2 cm and was 60% effaced, with a reactive fetal heart-rate tracing.

relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft, with tenderness in the right lower quadrant and no guarding or rebound.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvement in pain; continued mild diffuse abdominal discomfort without nausea or vomiting.

relevant_findings.abdomen: Soft and nontender, with a firm uterine fundus palpated at the umbilicus.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient felt well and was without pain.

vital_signs.blood_pressure: Initial 120/70 mm Hg, later ranging from 105 to 119 mm Hg systolic and 60 to 70 mm Hg diastolic.

relevant_findings.abdomen: Diffusely tender with rebound and guarding.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Severe abdominal pain developed suddenly, rated at 10 out of 10.
